titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale Library Associates Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday October 12, 2018 at 07:00

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, Trustee meeting minutes and records, new library acquisition files, and event ephemera from the Yale Library Associates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, Trustee meeting minutes and records, new library acquisition files, and event ephemera from the Yale Library Associates.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale Library Associates Records (RU 1145). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 32-C (YRG 32-C), Records of Yale University Library departments and offices.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by subject.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale Library Associates was founded in 1930 "to help keep the Library in its proper position as a great world-collection of books indispensable to the University whose heart and center it constitutes." Supporters are kept informed about Library news, and are invited to lectures, exhibitions, openings, receptions, performances, and symposia throughout the year.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.
